intro: Beilschmiedia jabassensis, commonly known as the Jabassé beilschmiedia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of South America, particularly in regions of Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a small, woody drupe that contains a single seed. Beilschmiedia jabassensis plays a role in its ecosystem as a food source for various insects and birds.
